channel.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
channel.description:
Looks like a steam forum member (StickZer0) found evidence about Episode 3 in the new free game Alien Swarm. [url='https://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showpost.php?p=16203270&postcount=1']His Post[/url]: [quote] Check this out for yourself guys, open the Alien Swarm SDK, place an info_node_hint and check the hint options.
What on earth is a Blob Brain? Or an Aperture Nest?
I don't know whether this proves Episode 3 or not, but I believe it's definitely evidence they're working on it! [/quote] [url='https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1471205/episode3proofstickzero.JPG']Image[/url]
Finally something about Episode 3 (I hope). :slight_smile:

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
JeffMOD:

sigh Really? This? Npc_blob and Aperture nest could really be anything, and they could just as likely be from Portal 2. Then there’s dias’ point,
And judging by the hints for Blob_brain, it seems to be a director type entity that could very well control the swarm’s strategies in AS.
And of course there are the snow textures in AS, but that means nothing. There are snow textures in HL2, does that mean it has Episode 3 content? No, it means the base source content has materials from the HL2 beta.

If you’ve looked at the image in the first post, you’d understand why this is probably EP3 content. The info_node_hints with the prefix EP3. Aside from Episode 3, I don’t see what else it could possibly mean. Especially when Episode 2 sdk content is often abbreviated as EP2.

And if you’ve seen at least one of the videos of NPC_Surface from the leaked source benchmark, you’d understand why I might think this has something to do with the hydra, especially considering that the npc itself gives an error that it’s missing Hydra.mdl

One of the main reasons that the hydra was cut from HL2(asside from being no fun) was that the AI was buggy & bad. It’s probable that the Brain of the hydra(the part that you need to hurt) is NPC_Blob. This way, rather than having multiple ugly polygonal tentacles being controlled by a single npc, they could have each individual tentacle be it’s own npc & have them directed by their core. If NPC_Blob was an entity in ASW used to direct ai with no physical presence in the world, then there’s no need for it to be an NPC.

Bobikan00sh:

i will admit you have viable points but my rebuttal is the most common i can think of: hl2 beta leak. that one leak caused valve to pretty much get cluster-fucked to the point of having to redo large sections of half life 2. conversely it took them several more years to complete the game.

Your rebuttal may be “the most common” but that just make it the most common misconception. Hundreds of people can say the world is flat, but that doesn’t mean it’s true. They redid large sections of HL2 repeatedly because those parts sucked. I know this, because the WC Map pack contains many of the maps used in the final game that replaced the ones seen in the E3 videos. THAT WOULDN’T MAKE ANY SENSE IF THAT CHANGER WERE CAUSED BY THE LEAK. It also didn’t take them “several more years” to complete, it only took 1. And that was after another delay that was announced in July.

Read full topic
item.source: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
sigh Really? This? Npc_blob and Aperture nest could really be anything, and they could just as likely be from Portal 2. Then there’s dias’ point,

Dias:

NPC_Blob & NPC_Surface were from a leaked particle benchmark. It’s thought to have been used mostly used for testing multicore-related stuff, but the leaked benchmark has some stuff about npc_surface using Hydra.mdl & the hydra textures could also be found in the texture files. That Alien Swarm .fgd info certainly helps my theory that the hydra will be brought back for EP3 as two separate npcs. NPC_surface probably controls the tentacles, while NPC_Blob controls the core/brain part that needs to be killed.

And judging by the hints for Blob_brain, it seems to be a director type entity that could very well control the swarm’s strategies in AS.
And of course there are the snow textures in AS, but that means nothing. There are snow textures in HL2, does that mean it has Episode 3 content? No, it means the base source content has materials from the HL2 beta.

Read full topic
item.source: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: Bobikan00sh
item.description:
Dias:

It was already posted in a discussion thread for Episode 3.

That’s where it should have stayed. Also:
That is completely and utterly untrue. Most of the leak content that people fixate over was last modified a year or two before the leak, and the leak also contains a lot of the finalized content that contradicts the older content, which if the game were changed because of the leak, there would be no way that stuff could be in the leak. There was also plenty of stuff cut & changed from HL1 that we know about, and that game was never leaked.

i will admit you have viable points but my rebuttal is the most common i can think of: hl2 beta leak. that one leak caused valve to pretty much get cluster-fucked to the point of having to redo large sections of half life 2. conversely it took them several more years to complete the game. like i said before its not that its a big leak but if people are going to look for a huge leak don’t start bitching when the boat starts sinking.

Read full topic
item.source: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
It was already posted in a discussion thread for Episode 3.

DiePoente:

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1471205/episode3proofstickzero.JPG

New Episode 3 enemy?

“Blob”

That’s where it should have stayed. Also:

Dias:

NPC_Blob & NPC_Surface were from a leaked particle benchmark. It’s thought to have been used mostly used for testing multicore-related stuff, but the leaked benchmark has some stuff about npc_surface using Hydra.mdl & the hydra textures could also be found in the texture files. That Alien Swarm .fgd info certainly helps my theory that the hydra will be brought back for EP3 as two separate npcs. NPC_surface probably controls the tentacles, while NPC_Blob controls the core/brain part that needs to be killed.

Bobikan00sh:

stop trying to find things about episode 3 or else you might fuck episode 3 up:fffuuu:

That is completely and utterly untrue. Most of the leak content that people fixate over was last modified a year or two before the leak, and the leak also contains a lot of the finalized content that contradicts the older content, which if the game were changed because of the leak, there would be no way that stuff could be in the leak. There was also plenty of stuff cut & changed from HL1 that we know about, and that game was never leaked.

Read full topic
item.source: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: Bobikan00sh
item.description:
i’d also like to point out at this time that any time someone finds code that valve left or forgot to take out valve usually gets burned by it and has to redo most (if not all) of the said game.

im not saying this is THAT huge but still nice to see people actively looking for code leaks then complains when valve has to start something from scratch. nice job assholes

you want a hint, ill give you one free of charge: stop trying to find things about episode 3 or else you might fuck episode 3 up:fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Adam Foster of MINERVA was supposedly working on the game before being transferred into the Left 4 Dead staff.

He went to the portal staff and does map development for them. He also made the Portal 2 ARG. I talk to him from time to time and I’m pretty sure his primary focus is Portal2 and does a bit for EP3. I’ve never heard him mention L4D. I could be wrong though.

Read full topic

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I’m guessing those must be code fragments from an earlier attempt at Ep3. After all, initially upon hiring, Adam Foster of MINERVA was supposedly working on the game before being transferred into the Left 4 Dead staff.

Potentially this could be an evolution on the cut tentacle monster in the Half Life 2 beta? After all, the game allegedly will involve the Borealis, so we can expect concepts and locations that were cut from HL2’s initial release to potentially make their way into the game.

Now if they put the Cremator back in, I’ll be really happy.

Read full topic

item.title: HL2 Episode 3 in Alien Swarm GCF's
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Silicon Chip:

The code isn’t in the right place.
Right now I’m asking for some help from a certain source coder.
I just want to see what new stuff we can get out of this.

Silicon Chip:

Sorry people, as it turns out, it’s not more than an empty shell.
Something of what once was.

The entities will not work in game and the code that links them is simply not there.

item.description:
Looks like a steam forum member (StickZer0) found evidence about Episode 3 in the new free game Alien Swarm. His Post:

Check this out for yourself guys, open the Alien Swarm SDK, place an info_node_hint and check the hint options.

What on earth is a Blob Brain? Or an Aperture Nest?

I don’t know whether this proves Episode 3 or not, but I believe it’s definitely evidence they’re working on it!

Image

Finally something about Episode 3 (I hope).
